If you're looking for a heartwarming story about a group of African American women during the Civil Rights movement, 'The Help' (2011) starring Viola Davis is a must-watch.

Ernest & Celestine is a heartwarming and heartwarming film about an unlikely friendship between a bear and a young mouse. The movie perfectly fits the war theme and has great performances.

Gone with the Wind is a classic romantic drama about a Southern belle and a roguish profiteer who face off in a turbulent romance during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods. The movie is visually stunning and has unforgettable performances.

Casablanca is a romantic comedy about a cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggling to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco. The movie is filled with iconic performances and beautiful cinematography.

Pandemonium is a thrilling and heartwarming film about a former high school student who always wanted to be a cheerleader decides to reopen the cheerleading program at her former high school after years of closure for being targeted by a serial killer.
